meanings.definition: The state or quality of being cellular.
meanings.sent1: The cellularity of the organism allows for efficient communication between cells.
meanings.sent2: The cellularity of the tissue was evident under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The cellularity of the sponge made it a great absorber of water.
meanings.sent4: The cellularity of the city's layout resembled a complex network of interconnected roads.
meanings.sent5: The cellularity of the honeycomb structure provided strength and stability.

meanings.definition: The property of consisting of or containing cells.
meanings.sent1: The cellularity of the plant tissue was crucial for photosynthesis.
meanings.sent2: The cellularity of the blood allows for the transport of oxygen.
meanings.sent3: The cellularity of the cake batter made it light and fluffy when baked.
meanings.sent4: The cellularity of the building blocks formed a sturdy foundation.
meanings.sent5: The cellularity of the beehive ensured efficient honey production.
